resources.string: By default, single tap on a node to edit it, double tap to add a children, do a long press to display the menu. Each action can be customized in the settings.

"A long press on any node will display a menu which will let you edit the selected node. 

 Note that if the file you are viewing is set as read-only by the file system, you'll see it's name displayed between [square brackets] in the title bar and you won't be able to edit this document. 

 You can use the save as option to create a copy of a read only document and edit it."
"Some common files are based on the XML format, for example HTML or SVG. \n\n Those files can be previewed directly from the menu inside a web browser."

"The XML format is a set of strict rules ensuring that a file can be readable by any software. Axel follows to the letter the XML Specification. \n\n As a result, some files may not be readable as they do not follow the XML specification. This is often the case with HTML documents, so Axel tries to extract a valid document from HTML documents."

"Some XML files are compressed inside a binary format, for performance or size optimisation purpose. Once in binary format, these files are not XML document anymore. \n\n However Axel can still read some of those, namely the Android XML files (eg : XML files from an APK archive) and binary PList (Apple PList files). These files are opened as read only but you can still save them in a copy and edit it."
